mission_task_and_description: Bull Troop GTA500 Tactical Road March (TRM) 07APR25

values: No non mission critical items on the outside of vehicles
All mission critical items must be secured with at least one point of redundancy.
-PCCs conducted morning of movement by VCs, SLs, and PSGs. -PCIs conducted by PLs and CO/XO
-VCs, SLs, PSGs, PLs, CO, and XO
PMCS and dispatches will be completed 26MAR25 in preparation.
New PMCS will be completed the morning of movement.
-SLs and PSGs will supervise PMCSing, PLs will ensure maintenance tasks are complete for movement
-Truck Crews -SLs -PSGs -PLs
Convoy Level COMMEX on 07APR25 across all systems.
Troop Level COMMEX on the morning of movement to ensure functional PACE plan.
-PLs, crews, and RTOs will install and test radio equipment in the trucks day prior. -CO and XO will confirm functionality the morning of movement.
-PL's, RTO's, VC's
Speed Limit (30kmh road, 20kmh trail)
100m spacing minimum
Center-line driving
Ground guides in tight or congested areas
-Full convoy brief conducted by Serial OIC -VCs/TCs control/instruct their drivers
-Serial OICs -VCs/TCs -Drivers

subtasks.hazard: Injured appendage or other noncritical injury (i.e. smashed finger)

values: Wear PPE throughout the mission (ACH, gloves, eye pro) including when dismounted.
-Briefed by Serial Commanders and PLs -Enforced by SLs and PSGs
-Serial Commanders -PLs -SLs and PSGs

subtasks.hazard: Critical/life-limb-eyesight injury (i.e. Soldier hit by Styker)

values: Ground guides mandatory if troops are dismounted
-Briefed by Serial Commanders and PLs -Enforced by SLs and PSGs
-Serial Commanders -PLs -SLs and PSGs
Assess road conditions prior to SP
Reduce speed for hazardous road conditions
Monitor USAG Bavaria Road Conditions every hour on the hour
-Briefed by Serial Commanders and PLs -Enforced by SLs and PSGs
-Serial Commanders -PLs -SLs and PSGs

overall_supervision_plan: The initial risk level was medium. The deliberate rehearsals and COMMEX ensure all SMs are aware of the route plan and contingency plans in place. Additionally, all SMs will have a copy of the Convoy Safety Checklist, on them at all times. The PCCs/PCIs prior to SP will mitigate any faulty load plans and ensure all equipment stays on the truck. Finally, the Convoy Brief will be another reminder for SMs of safe convoy practices, and it will allow for any questions to be asked prior to SP. Due to all the reasons stated above, the residual risk is mitigated to low.
